newsitem.title: USA: SyQuest granted exception on NASD rules.
newsitem.headline: SyQuest granted exception on NASD rules.

text.p: SyQuest Technology Inc said it was granted a temporary exception from the National Association of Securities Dealers to meet its stock listing requirements related to net tangible assets.
SyQuest said it expected to meet the NASD listing requirements by raising funds through the sale of its stock; but there can be no assurance that it will be able to do so.

SyQuest also said it received an exception from NASD to proceed with a proposed $30 million preferred stock investment transaction without stockholder approval. The transaction is to be facilitated by Wharton Capital Corp.

It said it obtained enough proxies to approve an amendment to its certificate of incorporation authorizing it to raise the number of shares to 60 million from 20 million. That would make the $30 million deal and future stock issuances possible.
The company will take up the share authorization at a September 26 stockholders meeting.
Syquest said those events should assist it in making our capital investment in a proposed joint venture with the Legend Group of China.
On September 10, SyQuest announced plans to form a joint venture with Legend for the manufacture and distribution of SyQuest removable cartridge hard drives and other products in China.
